elements.name: RCT Coverage
elements.label: Will the project provide its own RCT coverage?

elements.name: Contamination Present
elements.label: Is there process knowledge or historical information available to show there is contamination present in the area to be excavated?

elements.name: Contamination Note
elements.text: If the Guzzler becomes contaminated due to inadequate characterization of the dig site, the contractor will be responsible for decontamination costs.

elements.name: Excavation Description
elements.label: Excavation Description (Include the purpose, location and size of excavation)

elements.name: Expected Volume
elements.label: Expected volume of soil to be excavated (cubic yards):

elements.name: Expected Contamination
elements.text: Expected contamination levels for the soils to be excavated:

elements.name: Regulated Questions Text
elements.text: If you answer "Yes" to any of the following questions, the regulated Guzzler may not be used for your activity:

elements.name: Regulated Question 1
elements.label: Will excavation activities occur in areas containing radiological contamination greater than 400,000 dpm/100 cm2 beta/gamma?

elements.name: Regulated Question 2
elements.label: Will excavation activities occur in areas containing radiological contamination greater than 1,500 dpm/100 cm2 alpha?

elements.name: Regulated Question 3
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used in the handling of liquids?

elements.name: Regulated Question 4
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used in the handling of sewage?

elements.name: Regulated Question 5
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate beryllium-containing materials?

elements.name: Regulated Question 6
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate asbestos-containing materials?

elements.name: Regulated Question 7
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material which would contain Acute Dangerous Waste Sources (WAC 173-303-9904 - F020, F021, F022, F023, F026 or FO27)?

elements.name: Regulated Question 8
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material which would contain discarded chemical products (listed in WAC 173-303-9903) that are identified with a dangerous waste number beginning with a "P"?

elements.name: Regulated Question 9
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material that is toxic extremely hazardous waste (WT01) as identified in WAC 173-303-100?

elements.name: Regulated Question 10
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material containing pesticides?

constraints.content: values('Acknowledgements').indexOf("Guzzler will not be used for any activities if the outside air temperature is at or below 38 degrees Fahrenheit.")>=0 && values('Acknowledgements').indexOf("Guzzler will not be used for any activities if the sustained wind conditions reach or exceed 20 miles per hour.")>=0

choices.label: Guzzler will not be used for any activities if the outside air temperature is at or below 38 degrees Fahrenheit.
choices.value: Guzzler will not be used for any activities if the outside air temperature is at or below 38 degrees Fahrenheit.

choices.label: Guzzler will not be used for any activities if the sustained wind conditions reach or exceed 20 miles per hour.
choices.value: Guzzler will not be used for any activities if the sustained wind conditions reach or exceed 20 miles per hour.

elements.name: Regulated Text
elements.text:
Personnel who will be engaged in field activities involving Guzzler use (within 50 feet) must complete Course 031002 Guzzler Safety and Operations within the 36 months prior to starting work.

Personnel who will be operating the Guzzler must complete Course 031003 Guzzler Proficiency Checklist within the 36 months prior to starting work.

It is the responsibility of the requesting organization/contractor to engage qualified radiological personnel to ensure operation of the regulated Guzzler is in accordance with Permit Number AIR 18-201 (EU 476, NOC 1279).

elements.name: Non-Regulated Questions Text
elements.text: If you answer "Yes" to any of the following questions, the non-regulated Guzzler may not be used for your activity:

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 1
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used for removing/excavating soil that is radiologically (or potentially radiologically) contaminated?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 2
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate beryllium-containing materials?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 3
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate asbestos-containing materials?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 4
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material which would contain Acute Dangerous Waste Sources (WAC 173-303-9904 - F020, F021, F022, F023, F026 or F027)?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 5
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material which would contain discarded chemical products (listed in WAC 173-303-9903) that are identified with a dangerous waste number beginning with a "P"?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 6
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used to excavate material that is toxic extremely hazardous waste (WT01) as defined in WAC 173-303-100?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Question 7
elements.label: Will the Guzzler be used in the handling of sewage?

elements.name: Non-Regulated Text
elements.text:
Personnel who will be engaged in field activities involving Guzzler use (within 50 feet) must complete Course 031002 Guzzler Safety and Operations within the 36 months prior to starting work.

Personnel who will be operating the Guzzler must complete Course 031003 Guzzler Proficiency Checklist within the 36 months prior to starting work.
